bibl.title: Letter from Margeris Hogue to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 1, 1921

div1.p: This letter, written by a student of Edith R. Force, thanks Emilie Lawrence Reed for the life and work of Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Margeris Hogue to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 1, 1921
div1.opener:
Science 1B3
Tulsa, Oklahoma
June 1, 1921 Woodrow Wilson
Dear Mrs Reed
div1.p:
I thank you for your
huston being brave enought to
to dey for the sake of thougher
and will remember him for his
bravy “like Crist died for his
children” I mean that Mr.
Reed did, the same as
Christ did and I thank
you for It too. Have you
ever seen Tulsa if not I
will tell you about It
alought Tulsa is a small city
it is one of the most clean-
est cities of the U.S.
